subject: RBA adds AUD 4.28bln to banking system through repos vs. Prev. AUD 1.30bln
PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIA, JAPAN AND SOUTH KOREA STOCK NEWS: Corporate updates including NAB earnings and share placement announcement, Fanuc and Shinhan Financial Group
content:
AUSTRALIA

National Australia Bank (NAB AT) - Co. shares were halted as it announced H1 cash profit fell 51.4% Y/Y to AUD 1.44bln, rev. AUD 8.92bln vs. Prev. AUD 9.17bln Y/Y, interim dividend AUD 0.30/shr vs. Prev. AUD 0.83 Y/Y, Co. stated collective provisions include forward economic adjustment of AUD 807mln from COVID-19 impact, while it launched institutional placement and share purchase plan with the placement to be undertaken at fixed price of AUD 14.15/shr and will result in about 212mln new shares being issued representing 7.1% of existing ordinary shares on issue. (Newswires)

Aristocrat Leisure (ALL AT) - Co. notes around 1000 staff will be stood down until end of June and around 200 roles will be removed from the business, while around 200 full time workers will be moved to part-time roles. (Newswires)

CSL (CSL AT) - Co. is said to be facing increased scrutiny regarding its blood plasma collection business in the US amid concerns over how it handles the health and welfare of blood donors. (SMH)

Domain Holdings (DHG AT) - Co. Q1 rev. rose 1% Y/Y and it announced agreement for AUD 80mln debt facility. (Newswires)

Lend Lease (LLC AT) - Co. is said to be close to raising AUD 500mln-600mln by selling cashflows due from its One Sydney Harbour project. (Newswires) 

Macquarie Group (MQG AT) - Co. deal to sell down part of its Martin Place office towers in Sydney to ISPT has collapsed amid outlook uncertainty. (Newswires)

Newcrest Mining (NCM AT) - Co. said Papua New Guinea’s decision not to renew Barrick Gold’s lease for the Porgera gold mine, has no impact for Newcrest Mining and that its special mining lease is intact until renewal in 2035. (Newswires)

News Corp (NWS AT) - Co. will restructure its Australian newspaper division. (SMH)

Qube Holdings (QUB AT) - Co. is said to be considering a AUD 500mln capital raise. (Newswires)

Seven West Media (SWM AT) - Co. is said to report Q1 advertising rev. AUD 186.6mln vs. Prev. AUD 228.5mln Y/Y. (SMH)

Steadfast Group (SDF AT) - Co 9-month EBITDA rose 21% Y/Y to AUD 147.9mln, rev. rose 25.8% Y/Y to AUD 597.9mln. (Newswires)

Virgin Australia (VAHA T) - Regional Express Airlines is reportedly interested in taking over some of non-core regional routes. (Newswires)

Other News - Queensland announced to ease some coronavirus restrictions with outings allowed from next Saturday. (Newswires)

 

JAPAN

ACOM (8572 JT) - Co. lowers FY net guidance to JPY 59.6bln vs. Prev. JPY 75.5bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

ANA (9202 JT - Co. cuts FY19 net forecast to JPY 27.0bln from JPY 94.0bln. (Newswires)

Denso (6902 JT) - Co. cuts FY net guidance to JPY 68.0bln from JPY 225.0bln. (Newswires)

Dentsu (4324 JT) - Co. is to delay earnings release until late next month. (Newswires)

Fanuc (6954 JT) - Co. FY net JPY 73.4bln vs. Prev. JPY 154.2bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Japan Aviation Electronics Industry (6807 JT) - Co. FY net JPY 11.1bln vs. Prev. JPY 13.5bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Japan Post Insurance (7181 JT) - Co. plans to increase holdings of domestic stocks in FY20/21 and will likely reduce holdings of domestic bonds. (Newswires)

Mitsubishi Motors (7211 JT) - Co. lowers FY20 net guidance to loss JPY 26.0bln from forecast of JPY 5.0bln profit, lowers annual dividend plan to JPY 10/Shr from 20/Shr. (Newswires)

Nippon Sharyo (7102 JT) - Co. FY net JPY 7.9bln vs. Prev. JPY 9.2bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Other News - Japan is working on a subsidy to provide idled small-business employees 100% of their wages during the current state of emergency. (Nikkei)

 

SOUTH KOREA

GS Retail (007070 KS) - Co. Q1 net rose 371% Y/Y to KRW 49.4bln. (Newswires)

Hana Financial Group (086790 KS) - Co. Q1 net KRW 657bln vs. Prev. KRW 564bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Korean Air Lines (003490 KS) - South Korea state lenders said they will inject KRW 1.2tln into the airline. (Yonhap)

LG Hausys (108670 KS) - Co. Q1 net KRW 4.59bln vs. Prev. loss KRW 870mln. (Newswires)

S-1 Corp (012750 KS) - Co. Q1 net KRW 34.6bln vs. Prev. KRW 36.8bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Shinhan Financial (055550 KS) - Co. Q1 net KRW 949.5bln vs. Prev. KRW 965.8bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

subject: South Korea's 3rd extra budget is expected to be KRW 30tln, according to reports citing local press
RBA says excess cash at exchange settlement accounts at AUD 66.4bln vs. Prev.  AUD 69.6bln
US Secretary of State Pompeo is said to prepare a legal argument that US remains participant of JCPOA in an effort to pressure Iran and extend arms embargo, according to NYT
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR IS NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights include: Chinese Industrial Profits and BoJ Policy Decision; New Zealand is closed for ANZAC Day
South Korea Finance Minister says will boost development assistance to developing countries undergoing hardships from coronavirus, adds South Korea economy is facing unprecedented difficulties

National Australia Bank (NAB AT) H1 cash profit fell 51.4% Y/Y to AUD 1.44bln, rev. AUD 8.92bln vs. Prev. AUD 9.17bln, interim dividend AUD 0.30/shr vs. Prev. AUD 0.83, collective provisions include forward economic adjustment of AUD 807mln from COVID-19
content: Co. launches institutional placement and share purchase plan with the placement to be undertaken at fixed price of AUD 14.15/shr and will result in about 212mln new shares being issued representing 7.1% of existing ordinary shares on issue.
analysis_details: • As a reminder, NAB is among the big 4 banks in Australia and had been scheduled to announce earnings in May.

subject: US equity futures trade cautious after fading the opening gains as this week's risk events offset US reopening efforts and slowing coronavirus deaths in Europe
US CDC reports total coronavirus cases as of previous day at 1600EDT increased to 928,619 (Prev. 895,766), while total death toll was at 52,459 (Prev. 50,439)

Deutsche Bank (DBK GY) Co. prelim Q1 rev. EUR 6.40bln vs. Prev. EUR 6.35bln Y/Y, while it expects to report group profit before tax of EUR 206mln and net income at EUR 66mln, above market expectations

UK PM Johnson could ease lockdown restrictions before May 7 deadline and is expected to announce plans for easing lockdown as early as this week after returning to Downing Street, according to Telegraph

UK PM Johnson could ease lockdown restrictions before May 7 deadline and is expected to announce plans for easing lockdown as early as this week after returning to Downing Street, according to Telegraph
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
CORONAVIRUS UPDATE / RESPONSES

US government trial of Gilead's (GILD) Remdesivir is running ahead of schedule and results from the trial could be possible by mid-May, with potential for earlier preliminary results. However, other reports noted that preliminary results from a Remdesivir test by Chinese scientists found it may reduce sperm count in mice. (Newswires)

US Senate Minority Leader Schumer said momentum is growing for Congressional relief package for state and local governments, while there were also comments from US House Speaker Pelosi that "we will be ready soon" with the next bill to tackle COVID-19. (Newswires)

US is to cap the amount each bank can lend under the coronavirus relief program with the Small Business Administration to impose a maximum amount for individual lenders at 10% of the Paycheck Protection Program and pace the applications filed. (Newswires)

New York Governor Cuomo said the state will follow the CDC’s recommendation to wait until hospitalization rates decline for 14 days and outlined that phase 1 will involve construction and manufacturing activities which pose low risk, while phase 2 to be based on a business-by-business analysis of how essential it is and the associated risks. Furthermore, Governor Cuomo noted that the number of deaths in the state from coronavirus increased by 367 on Saturday vs. Prev. 437 on Friday, while there were comments from New York City Mayor De Blasio that the city needs USD 7.4bln from the government to offset impact from the outbreak. (Newswires/Fox)

Italy coronavirus cases rose by 2324 to a total of 197,675 and death toll increased by 260 vs. Prev. 415 which was the smallest daily increase since March 14th. In related news, Italy PM Conte announced to begin lifting the lockdown from May 4th in which bars and restaurants will be able to provide home deliveries and retailers are to reopen on May 18th, while he added that it is reasonable to expect schools to remain shut until the end of the school year. (Newswires)

UK coronavirus death toll in hospitals rose by 413 on Saturday to a total 20,732. (Newswires)

UK PM Johnson could ease lockdown restrictions before May 7 deadline and is expected to announce plans for easing lockdown as early as this week after returning to Downing Street. (The Telegraph)

UK Foreign Secretary Raab said lockdown restrictions need to be eased carefully, meaning that social distancing will remain for "some time", while there were separate comments from UK Environment, Food and Rural Affairs Minister Eustice that lockdown measures will be reviewed in a couple of weeks and that it is very important not to act too soon. (BBC/Newswires)

National Medical Director of NHS England Stephen Powis stated we now have a very definite trend of reduced hospitalizations and that it is highly likely there will be different types of measures combined which will keep transmission rate down. (Newswires)

 

ASIA-PAC

China National People’s Congress is expected to take place at end-May in which they could announce a new stimulus package and set this year’s growth targets. (Newswires)

 

UK/EU

UK said it had a full and constructive Brexit negotiating round although there has been limited progress in bridging the gaps with the EU and there is regret that the EU's details in its offer on goods trade falls short of precedent in FTAs. Furthermore, it added there are other areas of significant difference that they will not make progress on the so-called "level playing field". (Newswires)

EU Brexit Negotiator Barnier said a political compromise will be needed to make real Brexit progress not just the technical clarification of both sides' positions and that the UK failed to engage substantially on topics last week. Barnier stated there has been no progress on fisheries and that the EU will not agree to any future partnership that does not include a balanced solution on fisheries. (Newswires)

French Finance Minister Le Maire announced a EUR 7bln package for Air France (AF FP) and are working on a EUR 5bln package for Renault (RNO FP), while Dutch Finance Minister Hoekstra announced a EUR 2bln-4bln support package for the Dutch arm of Air France-KLM (AF FP), although details are still under consideration. (Newswires)

Bank of Italy have been buying Italian Gov't bonds on behalf of the ECB and purchased slightly higher than recent days average, according to sources. (Newswires)

S&P affirmed United Kingdom at AA; Outlook Stable and affirmed Italy at BBB; Outlook Negative, while it affirmed Portugal at BBB; Outlook revised to Stable from Positive and affirmed Greece at BB-; Outlook revised to Stable from Positive on adverse effects of COVID-19. (Newswires)

Fitch affirmed Netherlands at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable. (Newswires)

 

COMMODITIES

Baker Hughes US Rig Count (w/e Apr. 24th) oil rigs fell by 60 to 378 and nat gas rigs fell by 4 to 85, while total rigs fell by 64 to 465. (Newswires)

US President Trump believes Saudi Arabia and Russia could make further production cuts and believes that will be a natural process now, while he added that Texas, Oklahoma and Canada are cutting production. (Newswires)

US Treasury Secretary Mnuchin said it can be assumed that one option is that the administration is looking at the government taking stakes in energy companies and that several options are being examined, while he added that President Trump also floated the idea of the US government purchasing fuel in the US in advance, as well as airline tickets. (Newswires)

US Oil Fund (USO) may allocate 20% of its portfolio in June contracts (prev. 20%), 40% in July futures (Prev. 50%), 20% in August (Prev. 20%) and 20% in September (Prev. 10%). (Newswires)

 

GEOPOLITICS

Iranian President Rouhani urged the Iranian military to follow strategies ensuring regional stability while keeping vigilance and a strong presence, according to state TV. (Newswires)

Japanese media report claimed that North Korea Leader Kim was in a vegetative state following heart surgery. In related news, North Korea state radio issued a statement reportedly from Leader Kim in appreciation of workers furnishing Samjiyon but made no comments on his health or whereabouts. (Yonhap) 

 

US

Fed plans to purchase USD 50bln in Treasury purchases for the upcoming week from USD 75bln total last week. (Newswires)

White House Adviser Hassett said the US unemployment rate is likely to reach 16% or higher when this month’s jobs report is released. (Newswires)

 

MARKET RECAP

The week ended on a positive risk tone as equities and oil emerged firmer with the VIX moving closer to 35. The fundamental backdrop hasn’t changed drastically since Thursday’s remdesivir trial “flop” report, although a Reuters report that US remdesivir trials were running ahead of schedule did provide some support, although gains had been made before then. It appeared to be more that risk has clawed its way back. Alphabet Inc (GOOG) is reportedly planning to cut marketing budgets as much as 50%, according to CNBC citing an internal document. Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN) will be asked to provide clarity from the House Judiciary Committee to whether or not it misled Congress in a sworn testimony after a WSJ report highlighted the co’s use of third-party data to develop products. Gilead Sciences (GILD) report yesterday that its first trial in China “flopped” is “not correct”, according to a doctor who helped with the study, who added his interpretation does not match with the headline. Note, a research note from Citi notes the report will likely curb the enthusiasm, but the analyst believes the success of the drug is at 50:50. Eli Lilly & Co. (LLY) announced it expects to start human testing for its experimental COVID-19 treatment as soon as next month that uses antibodies from those who have recovered from the disease, according to WSJ. Intel (INTC) beat on EPS and revenue, while announced it maintained its dividend, Q2 guidance fell short of expectations and it saw strong DCG and CCG revenues. INTC trade lower however amid a worry that the strong figures will not last as it has seen a boost in business from COVID-19. Verizon (VZ) beat on EPS although missed on revenue while cut its FY20 EPS view and withdrew its revenue forecast. American Express (AXP) beat on EPS, missed on revenue. Its loan loss provisions increased to 2.6bln (exp. 1.3bln), while it committed to no layoffs amid COVID-19 throughout FY20. SPX +1.4% at 2837, NDX +1.7% at 8788, DJI +1.1% at 23,775.

Choppy day for the Treasury complex, albeit in tight ranges with the 10-year yield bouncing between 58/62bps, before moving lower on the updated Fed purchases schedule. As risk appetite rose in the European session, T-Notes and Bunds were offered from their highs overnight. However, after the US cash equity open gains were pared in equities/oil and yields were anchored from rising any further; note that relatively less corporate issuance likely also supported the Treasury curve. Then later, yields broke out of their range to the downside as investors digested the less pronounced cut in Fed asset purchases of USD 10bln/day from 35bln/day (read below). By settlement, 2s unchanged at 0.22, 10s -2bps at 0.59, and 30s -3bps at 1.17%. Meanwhile, Short end rates were supported after the 3-month USD LIBOR posted a chunky 10bps fall, supporting front pack Eurodollars and seeing swap spreads and FRA-OIS tighten. T-notes (M0) settled 3 ticks higher at 139-03+.
